Setting Chart Series Properties

Note: This topic applies to charting in the Windows client only.

The application Chart window allows you to customize each series in a chart separately by using the Series tab on the Custom Properties dialog. Depending on the type of chart you select, some options become disabled.

To set chart series options:

  1. Display a chart.

  2. Click the Chart Options button on the Chart window toolbar. This action displays the Chart Properties dialog.

  3. Select the Series tab.

  4. From the Series list box, specify the series for which you are setting options.

  5. In the Type group box, set these options:

    • Multiple types: Select to display a multiple-type chart – that is, a chart with more than one series.
      When checked, you must specify a type for each series from this dialog. When cleared, you specify a chart type by using the Gallery button on the Chart window toolbar or the Gallery type drop-down list box on the General tab.

    • The Gallery type drop-down list box enables you to select a chart type when you have checked Multiple types. The only available chart types are Area, Cubes, Points (or Marks), Vertical Bar (or Column), Line, and Spline (fit to curve). Pie and Doughnut charts are special cases. They have multiple series, so each slice can be assigned a different color, but only one type.

    • Point markers: Select to display or clear to hide point markers.

    • Show values: Select to display or clear to hide the values for elements. To show values on charts that display points, Point markers must also be checked. If you want to see the values only, move the Point size slider in the General tab to the far left.

    • Borders: Select to display or clear to hide the borders that define elements, such as bars.

    • Area lines: Select to display or clear to hide the vertical lines in area charts that connect each point to the x-axis.

    • Candlesticks: For hi-low charts only. Select to display the elements as candlestick charts or clear to display the elements as bars.

    • Connecting lines: Select to connect the points in the chart or clear to remove the lines that connect the points.

  6. Next, move to the Shape group box, and select appropriate options. The name of this group varies with the type of chart. It may be Bar shape, 3D line’s shape, or 3D bar’s shape. The available options also vary. All possible options are listed below.

    • Series color: Select a color for chart elements in this series.

    • Multiple shapes: Select to use a different shape for each series or clear to use the same shape for all series.

    • No. of vertex text box and slider: Enter the number of vertices for the shape, or move the slider to indicate that number. The range is from 1 to 16. If you use a number outside the range, the nearest number inside the range is used.

    • Conic: Select to make the elements conical, or clear to make the elements cylindrical.

    • 3D line thick text box and slider: Enter the thickness for the line, or move the slider to indicate that number. (The range is from 1 to 16. If you use a number outside the range, the nearest number inside the range is used.) The sample shows an element with the number of vertices you selected.

  7. After making your selections, click Apply to apply your settings without closing the dialog. Moving to another tab is equivalent to clicking Apply.

  8. To close the dialog, click OK.
